title: New Whitepaper Reveals Trillion-Dollar Opportunity for Corporate Climate Action in Asia - BCG
summary: A new report by the World Economic Forum, BCG, and SAP highlights the potential of climate action in Asia, noting a USD$4.3 trillion revenue opportunity by 2030 for businesses investing in green technologies. The report also emphasizes the substantial impact of climate change on Asian economies, with predictions of significant GDP reductions if action is not taken. The report outlines a best practice for corporate climate action and encourages collaboration between businesses, governments, and communities to accelerate the transition to a more sustainable future.

title: Advancing Human and Planetary Health: Enabling Healthy Diets and Addressing Climate Change - Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
summary: The FAO in Geneva Nutrition Dialogue Series focused on addressing the nexus between climate change and nutrition. The Initiative on Climate Action and Nutrition (I-CAN) aims to improve nutrition outcomes and support climate change mitigation. The dialogue highlighted country experiences in Malawi, Pakistan, and Ethiopia that demonstrate practical examples of agrifood systems transformation for healthier diets and reduced environmental impact.

title: Tillamook County Creamery Association Partners With New Seasons Market to Drive Climate Action; Jocelyn Bridson ... - Deli Market News
summary: Tillamook County Creamery Association (TCCA) and New Seasons Market (NSM) are partnering to establish a native riparian forest habitat on farmland in Tillamook County. This project will plant five acres of native trees and shrubs to sequester carbon, protect water quality, and enhance wildlife habitat. The project aims to improve both companies' environmental footprints and help them meet their climate goals.

title: New York's Mannan Supermarket Partners with Charity Group to Improve Food Security - Progressive Grocer
summary: Mannan Supermarket, a halal grocer in Queens, New York, is partnering with the Zara Charitable Foundation to combat food insecurity among local children. The foundation will fund fresh, culturally relevant food from Mannan for 200 families served by The Gaton Foundation, addressing the rising cost of food and reduced food benefits. This initiative aims to provide struggling families with access to nutritious and culturally appropriate meals.

title: California approves rule phasing out big diesel trucks - CBS Sacramento
summary: California is phasing out diesel-powered trucks by 2036 to combat climate change and reduce pollution. The new rule requires companies to disclose their use of drayage trucks by 2024 and would affect the transportation of goods through ports. The decision follows previous regulations requiring electric or hydrogen-powered cars by 2035 and aims to achieve carbon neutrality by 2045.

title: Austria launches $16 million rebate scheme for residential storage - pv magazine International
summary: Austria has launched a subsidy scheme to promote residential battery storage systems, offering up to €200 per kWh of usable storage capacity. The program aims to integrate these technologies into the power grid, especially in areas with limited grid capacity or high renewable energy generation. The battery storage systems must be installed by authorized installers and operated for at least 10 years.

title: Crown Coaches invests in Viva Energy carbon neutral diesel | News - Australasian Bus and Coach
summary: Crown Coaches, a Melbourne bus operator, has partnered with Viva Energy to fuel its entire fleet with opt-in Carbon Neutral Diesel, a Climate Active certified product. This move is part of Crown Coaches' commitment to a sustainable future and Viva Energy's broader effort to help businesses decarbonize. The partnership is seen as a transitional solution for companies with heavy vehicle fleets as they transition towards lower-emission technologies.

title: Viva Energy launches opt-in Carbon Neutral Diesel program - Big Rigs
summary: Viva Energy, an Australian energy company, is offering "opt-in Carbon Neutral Diesel" as a transitional solution for businesses to reduce their carbon footprint. title: The Battle for Net Zero Will Be Won or Lost in Asia - BCG
summary: Asia is facing a critical climate challenge due to its high energy consumption and emissions, but also has the opportunity to lead on climate solutions. The region needs to drastically reduce emissions to achieve the Paris Agreement goals, and companies have a crucial role to play in this transition. By taking immediate action, enabling transformation, and unlocking new growth, Asian companies can contribute to a sustainable future while gaining a competitive advantage.
